metadata.title: Viral Infection in Acute Exacerbation of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis

abstract.original_text: selection of patients and acquisition of samples: The etiology of acute exacerbation of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis remains unknown. Occult viral infection has been proposed as one possible cause of acute exacerbation of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

sentences.segment_text: selection of patients and acquisition of samples : The etiology of acute exacerbation of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis remains unknown .
Occult viral infection has been proposed as one possible cause of acute exacerbation of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis .

abstract.original_text: This study uses the most current genomics-based technologies to investigate the possible infectious etiology of acute exacerbations of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. Most cases demonstrate no evidence of viral infection. Torque teno virus was present in a significant minority of cases, and cases of acute lung injury.
